functions.name: arrayLength
doc: Get the length of an array
return: The array's length; null if not an array

functions.name: datetimeDay
doc: Get the day of the month of a datetime

args.name: utc
doc: Optional (default is false). If true, return the UTC day of the month.

functions.name: datetimeHour
doc: Get the hour of a datetime

args.name: utc
doc: Optional (default is false). If true, return the UTC hour.

functions.name: datetimeISOFormat
doc: Format the datetime as an ISO date/time string

args.name: isDate
doc: If true, format the datetime as an ISO date

functions.name: datetimeISOParse
return: The datetime, or null if parsing fails

functions.name: datetimeMinute
doc: Get the number of minutes of a datetime

args.name: utc
doc: Optional (default is false). If true, return the UTC minutes.

functions.name: datetimeMonth
doc: Get the number of the month (1-12) of a datetime

args.name: utc
doc: Optional (default is false). If true, return the UTC month.

args.name: minutes
doc: Optional (default is 0). The number of minutes.

args.name: seconds
doc: Optional (default is 0). The number of seconds.

args.name: milliseconds
doc: Optional (default is 0). The number of milliseconds.

args.name: minutes
doc: Optional (default is 0). The number of minutes.

args.name: seconds
doc: Optional (default is 0). The number of seconds.

args.name: milliseconds
doc: Optional (default is 0). The number of milliseconds.

functions.name: datetimeSecond
doc: Get the number of seconds of a datetime

args.name: utc
doc: Optional (default is false). If true, return the UTC seconds.

functions.name: datetimeYear
doc: Get the full year of a datetime

args.name: utc
doc: Optional (default is false). If true, return the UTC year.

functions.name: mathAbs
doc: Compute the absolute value of a number
return: The absolute value of the number

functions.name: mathAcos
doc: Compute the arccosine, in radians, of a number
return: The arccosine, in radians, of the number

functions.name: mathAsin
doc: Compute the arcsine, in radians, of a number
return: The arcsine, in radians, of the number

functions.name: mathAtan
doc: Compute the arctangent, in radians, of a number
return: The arctangent, in radians, of the number

functions.name: mathAtan2
doc: Compute the angle, in radians, between (0, 0) and a point

functions.name: mathCeil
doc: Compute the ceiling of a number (round up to the next highest integer)

functions.name: mathCos
doc: Compute the cosine of an angle, in radians

functions.name: mathFloor
doc: Compute the floor of a number (round down to the next lowest integer)

functions.name: mathLn
doc: Compute the natural logarithm (base e) of a number
return: The natural logarithm of the number

functions.name: mathLog
doc: Compute the logarithm (base 10) of a number

functions.name: mathRandom
doc: Compute a random number between 0 and 1, inclusive

functions.name: mathRound
doc: Round a number to a certain number of decimal places

args.name: digits
doc: Optional (default is 0). The number of decimal digits to round to.

functions.name: mathSign
doc: Compute the sign of a number
return: -1 for a negative number, 1 for a positive number, and 0 for zero

functions.name: mathSin
doc: Compute the sine of an angle, in radians

functions.name: mathSqrt
doc: Compute the square root of a number
return: The square root of the number

functions.name: mathTan
doc: Compute the tangent of an angle, in radians

functions.name: numberParseFloat
doc: Parse a string as a floating point number

functions.name: numberParseInt
doc: Parse a string as an integer

functions.name: numberToFixed
doc: Format a number using fixed-point notation

args.name: digits
doc: Optional (default is 2). The number of digits to appear after the decimal point.

args.name: trim
doc: Optional (default is false). If true, trim trailing zeroes and decimal point.

functions.name: objectGet
return: The value or null if the key does not exist

args.name: keyValues...
doc: The object's initial key and value pairs

functions.name: regexNew
return: The regular expression or null if the pattern is invalid

args.name: lines...
doc: text lines (may contain nested arrays of un-split lines)

args.name: lines
doc: text lines (may contain nested arrays of un-split lines)

functions.name: schemaValidate
doc: Validate an object to a schema type
return: The validated object or null if validation fails

functions.name: stringCharCodeAt
doc: Get a string index's character code

functions.name: stringEndsWith
doc: Determine if a string ends with a search string
return: true if the string ends with the search string, false otherwise

functions.name: stringFromCharCode
doc: Create a string of characters from character codes

functions.name: stringIndexOf
doc: Find the first index of a search string in a string

args.name: index
doc: Optional (default is 0). The index at which to start the search.

return: The first index of the search string; -1 if not found.

functions.name: stringLastIndexOf
doc: Find the last index of a search string in a string

args.name: index
doc: Optional (default is the end of the string). The index at which to start the search.

return: The last index of the search string; -1 if not found.

functions.name: stringLength
doc: Get the length of a string
return: The string's length; null if not a string

functions.name: stringNew
doc: Create a new string from a value

args.name: count
doc: The number of times to repeat the string

functions.name: stringReplace
doc: Replace all instances of a string with another string

functions.name: stringSlice
doc: Copy a portion of a string

args.name: start
doc: Optional (default is 0). The start index of the slice.

args.name: end
doc: Optional (default is the end of the string). The end index of the slice.

args.name: separator
doc: The separator string or regular expression

args.name: limit
doc: The maximum number of strings to split into

functions.name: stringStartsWith
doc: Determine if a string starts with a search string
return: true if the string starts with the search string, false otherwise

functions.name: stringTrim
doc: Trim the whitespace from the beginning and end of a string

functions.name: systemFetch
doc: Retrieve a remote JSON or text resource

args.name: url
doc: The resource URL or array of URLs

args.name: isText
doc: Optional (default is false). If true, retrieve the resource as text.

return: The resource object/string or array of objects/strings; null if an error occurred.

functions.name: systemGlobalGet
return: The global variable's value or null if it does not exist

functions.name: systemLog
doc: Log a message to the console

functions.name: systemLogDebug
doc: Log a message to the console, if in debug mode

functions.name: systemPartial
doc: If additional arguments are passed to the returned function, they are appended to "args".
